meanings.definition: The quality or state of being monochromatic.
meanings.sent1: The monochromaticity of the painting made it easy to match with any decor.
meanings.sent2: The artist's use of monochromaticity in the artwork created a calming effect.
meanings.sent3: The monochromaticity of the room was so extreme that it felt like stepping into a black and white movie.
meanings.sent4: Her wardrobe displayed a monochromaticity that reflected her minimalist style.
meanings.sent5: The monochromaticity of the sunset painted the sky in shades of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: The property of having only one color.
meanings.sent1: The monochromaticity of the flag symbolized unity and strength.
meanings.sent2: The flower's monochromaticity made it stand out among the colorful garden.
meanings.sent3: The monochromaticity of his outfit made him look like a walking rainbow.
meanings.sent4: The monochromaticity of the ocean during the storm was both eerie and beautiful.
meanings.sent5: The monochromaticity of the desert landscape was broken only by the occasional cactus.
